documents.document: @andymcgeady @patmccarry @jamesdowney23 @KMcLaughlin6 Great Pod Guys. Best yet imho. Covered lots and really fluid conversation between panel. Sometimes ye are a bit steccato/tentative. But that’s Andy’s responsibility 😜 Tempo tempo
RT @paolaa_janet: I’m 100% convinced my grandma was the reason Mexico won https://t.co/9jBRF5wFPE
RT @MattRCNM: One 300 m walk on the beach with my kids near Biarritz & we collected all this plastic, netting, fishing equipment & plastic…
@patmccarry Suggestion #3: Is the Tongan Thor a legit challenger to King Tadhg? Lots of clips of dynamic, fast running 130+kg try-scoring props to build a high-click, viral story around before Sydney
@patmccarry Will I here anything about the King Hit on Conway? 😁
@patmccarry I listen every week. Listening now. Tnx

@patmccarry A few other suggestions for analysis: 1. How we have had zero tries from 4 TMO decisions in 2 games. 2: Franno’s point that Healy was entitled to pull down the maul once it was over our try line. No try. No sin binning.
@patmccarry 😜

@patmccarry After 10 years & 265 front row games u bet he has previous. About 1 incident every 50+ games, ergo irrelevant. There are 100s of off the ball bumps, pinning, leg holding, hits 2 try scorers in every game. Why aren’t u running a campaign on Hayley-Petty game ending hit on Conway?

@patmccarry On what basis do you think that warrants another look by officials? Purely due to Cheika remarks 1st & media hype 2nd imho. There are literally 100s of other similar scenarios in every game.

@ruggerblogger So do you ignore opinion based on fact? Most all of those tweets on Sam (he is a big & accountable boy) aren’t even about the Grosso incident. He plays with a malicious edge. All those people and seasoned watchers/reporters in a wide variety of countries aren’t wrong You related?

@patmccarry Well your editors are making a meal of it and I’d say I am closer to Uncle Joe’s wishes in asking that it be dropped as an unwelcome story. https://t.co/KJvlet4UPj have pushed it more than the Aussie media and “every little helps”!

@ruggerblogger After 10 years & 265 caps for Leinster & Ireland His record shows he is clearly not. Very occasionally he is a reckless counter rucker. Has never ever rendered anyone unconscious or been involved in cracking skulls. Stamped on another prop’s ankle in 2013 was the worst in 10 yrs

@SportsJOEdotie @patmccarry Have to say your clickbait approach to the Healy-Genia non-event is not supportive of our team’s efforts with comments like “could be cited yet” & “naughty”. Move on please

@ruggerblogger Search “Sam Cane” on Twitter and see how he is universally regarded. I think he is probably the most complete 7 in world rugby. But an unnecessarily dirty bugger which Pooper, McCaw & Co don’t resort to. Deal with the truth https://t.co/yv6bl3Lwjz
@ruggerblogger You can’t mean this? Not comparable https://t.co/xMUSvLafJy

@WorldRugby @AllBlacks Just do a search on twitter, see & consider how the rugby community views the very talented but consistently dirty @SamCane7 He is a danger to other players. Please deal with it. @Rugbyworldmag @PlanetRugby @nzherald @gallagherbren #rugby #HIA
#Cyclists take note of last few seconds of this video https://t.co/73NxLNM5jf
@ruggerblogger @metlinkwgtn Now you are being honest about Sam Cane. Searching his name on twitter shows how the rugby world sees him #dirtyplayer

@MarcusJDillon @threeredkings 1st pick: POM, Leavy, SOB @ 8; 2nd pick: Ruddock, VDF, CJ (is a shade weaker); 3rd pick is a good step back; Tadhg, Jordi, Conan…but I accept your point that we have amazing back row quality (mainly Leinster born Bar 1 Corkonian & a Saffer
